[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Replay attack] Can an attacker capture and replay a signed transaction by manipulating the sequence number or timestamp before submission? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Gas price manipulation] Can an attacker exploit the gas price estimation logic to cause transactions to fail or consume excessive gas by providing manipulated gas_unit_price values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Clock skew exploitation] The function checks clock skew with ACCEPTED_CLOCK_SKEW_US - can an attacker manipulate their local clock to generate transactions with invalid expiration times? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Simulation bypass] Can an attacker bypass the simulation check that validates transaction success by manipulating the simulate_with_gas_estimation response? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Max gas underestimation] Does the adjusted_max_gas calculation using adjust_gas_headroom provide sufficient buffer, or can complex transactions exceed the limit causing failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Sequence number race] Can an attacker exploit race conditions between fetching account.sequence_number and transaction submission to cause nonce reuse? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Hardware wallet signature bypass] When using HardwareWalletType::Ledger, can an attacker intercept or manipulate the signature process? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::get_key_and_address()] [Key-address mismatch] Can get_key_and_address() return a private key that doesn't correspond to the returned address, causing transactions to be signed incorrectly? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::auth_key()] [Auth key tampering] Can an attacker manipulate the authentication key retrieved from the REST API to bypass transaction validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::sequence_number()] [Sequence number manipulation] Can sequence_number() return stale or manipulated values that cause transaction ordering violations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Nonce replay] When replay_protection_type is ReplayProtectionType::Nonce, can an attacker replay transactions by exploiting weak nonce generation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Sequence number bypass] Can an attacker bypass sequence number checks by switching between Nonce and Seqnum replay protection types? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [RNG weakness] The nonce generation uses rand::thread_rng() - is this cryptographically secure, or can nonces be predicted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Upgrade payload bypass] Can upgrade_payload_with_rng() be exploited to create malformed transactions that bypass replay protection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: GasOptions] [Gas price overflow] Can extremely large gas_unit_price or max_gas values cause integer overflow when calculating transaction costs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::estimate_gas_price()] [Price manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate the REST API response to provide fraudulent gas price estimates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Expiration manipulation] Can expiration_secs be set to extreme values (0 or very large) to cause transaction acceptance issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Gas estimation bypass] Can simulated_txn.info.gas_used be manipulated to cause incorrect max_gas calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: TransactionOptions::submit_transaction()] [Headroom calculation] The hardcoded value of 530 minimum gas units - can transactions requiring less gas exploit this to waste user funds? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: SaveFile::save_to_file_confidential()] [Permission bypass] On non-Unix systems, does save_to_file_confidential() properly restrict file permissions to prevent unauthorized access? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: SaveFile::check_file()] [TOCTOU race] Can an attacker exploit a time-of-check-time-of-use race between check_file() and save_to_file() to overwrite protected files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: SaveFile::save_to_file()] [Path traversal] Can output_file path be manipulated to write files outside the intended directory through '../' sequences? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/common/types.rs] [Function: SaveFile::save_to_file_confidential()] [Atomic write failure] If save_to_file_confidential() fails mid-write, can partial private key data be left on disk in a readable state? (Medium)
